newsitem.title: USA: Compression has new videoconference system.
newsitem.headline: Compression has new videoconference system.

text.p: Compression Labs Inc said Wednesday it was introducing a new videoconferencing system that combines Internet access, an advanced personal computer and multipoint videoconferencing capabilities.
The company said its Lunar meeting system provides T.120 compatability and includes Microsoft Corp's Internet Explorer, Microsoft Office and Microsoft Windows 95 software.

The system supports transmission speeds from 56 to 768 kilobits per second and incluudes a personal computer with a 133 megahertz Intel Pentium processor along with suupport for NTSC and PAL video formats.

The system comes with a table-top microphone, speakers and a camera as standard equuipment, along with a high-resolution SVGA 29-inch monitor, and is available immediately in ISDN-compatible packages starting at $13,950.
